image.altText: A side shot of a man with dark hair speaking into news microphones as he walks away from the courthouse.

props.synopsis: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright was earlier this year found guilty on two counts of attempting to pervert the course of justice. Today, the court will consider his sentence.

title.children: Matt Wright could be sentenced today — here's everything you need to know

image.altText: A supermarket fresh food aisle.

props.synopsis: A wholesaler hopes a review of a controversial outback food subsidy scheme will be independent and transparent.

title.children: Independent wholesaler cautiously welcomes food subsidy scheme review

image.altText: Man in white shirt and black tie walking

props.synopsis: Gavin Morris, the former principal of Yipirinya School in Alice Springs, has received an 18-month suspended sentence for the aggravated assault of four students.

title.children: Ex-Alice Springs principal handed suspended sentence for assaulting students

image.altText: A gas exploration site in outback scrubland.

props.synopsis: Major global oil and gas companies are expressing "serious interest" in the Beetaloo Basin for the first time, one analyst says, now that Beetaloo Energy has reached a final investment decision and committed to developing its fracking project.

title.children: Gas company clears final hurdle for fracking in the Beetaloo Basin

image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court.

props.synopsis: The NT Court of Criminal Appeal has heard an appeal against the sentence for a 24-year-old driver who avoided a jail sentence after hitting two Aboriginal pedestrians with his vehicle, killing one, and then boasting about it over text.

title.children: 'Vile' and 'repugnant' texts sent by fatal hit-run driver at centre of appeal

image.altText: Tiwi person with traditional paint on face dances with hands up during ceremony

props.synopsis: The agreement with the federal government sees the Tiwi Islands included in Australia's national parks and reserves system.

title.children: Tiwi Islands become 700,000-hectare Indigenous Protected Area

image.altText: A street in a town with a clock tower that has a temperature sign reading 32 degrees Celsius.

props.synopsis: A business owner has called for a youth curfew in Tennant Creek, after a weekend crime spree involving the theft of multiple cars, rams raids and a police chase through the Northern Territory town.

title.children: Tennant Creek business wants youth curfew but NT police 'not considering it'

image.altText: A picture of two septic tanks with lids off in a remote community backyard.

props.synopsis: Aboriginal housing advocates are calling for urgent improvements to the way remote public housing is maintained in the Northern Territory, after the coroner found the death of a toddler who fell into a backyard septic tank could have been prevented.

title.children: Calls for government action after toddler's septic tank death

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at press conference

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has declared the government has reached a deal to keep the Tomago aluminium smelter running until 2028. Follow live.

title.children: Tomago smelter to stay open post 2028 in federal government power deal

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sussan Ley offers bipartisanship to reform rules for parliamentary entitlements
Reddit launches legal challenge to under-16s social media ban
Independent MP concerned NACC commissioner is having to defend reputation

image.altText: anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Parents will thank the government for giving them more agency in dealing with the social media issue but kids aren't voters and it is hard to see the issue deciding votes either way.

title.children: Albanese's social media ban is bold, but it will take years to judge its success

image.altText: Screenshots of advertisements on Chinese social media promoting illegal immigration to Australia

props.synopsis: Recent boat arrivals in Western Australia offer a glimpse into how routes through South-East Asia, particularly Indonesia, are being used to reach Australia.

title.children: As US borders tighten, Australia becomes the new target for desperate Chinese migrants

image.altText: A designed image showing the Eagle Farm arch, horses racing on the track, apartment buildings and the BRC logo.

props.synopsis: Members of Queensland's richest horse racing club are demanding answers after they discovered its former chairman struck a lucrative deal with the developer of its luxury residential precinct while he had oversight of the $850 million project.

title.children: Backlash against Queensland's richest race club over former chair's income

image.altText: Ms Mason in a pink top, pink flower in her hair, wearing sunglasses, in front of the harbour.

props.synopsis: Bathurst mother and lawyer Emma Mason's advocacy for Australia's social media ban has always been in honour of her late daughter, Tilly.

title.children: How a Bathurst mother stood up to world leaders on social media ban

image.altText: A pixelated background with various video game characters leaping in the air.

props.synopsis: The biggest night in gaming is getting underway in the heart of downtown Los Angeles. Follow along in our live blog.

title.children: 2025 Game Awards launch in Los Angeles

image.altText: A graphic image showing the NDIS logo, a hand on a calculator, and stacks of folders.

props.synopsis: The finer details of a new NDIS planning system are yet to be finalised, but it's already drawing comparisons to failed Coalition-era reforms, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

title.children: NDIS 'robo-plans': What we know — and what we don't

image.altText: A composite Andrew David and Maurice Hawell in suits outside court

props.synopsis: Maurice Hawell and Andrew David, both 31, had been convicted of multiple counts of aggravated sexual assault and aggravated sexual touching in company, following a joint trial in the District Court last year.

title.children: Judge grants bail for Sydney men after pack-rape convictions quashed

image.altText: Sketch of man in green shirt sitting at table, orange background

props.synopsis: A former Sydney out-of-school-hours care worker has pleaded guilty to producing and possessing child abuse material and committing sexual acts against children while filming.

title.children: Former out-of-school-hours care worker pleads guilty to child abuse offences

image.altText: Ashley Griffith was photographed sitting with a child in his lap while employed at a daycare centre.

props.synopsis: Ashley Paul Griffith was sentenced to life in prison last year for sexually abusing 69 girls at childcare centres in Brisbane and Italy over a two-decade period.

title.children: Review leaves parents to grapple with failings that enabled paedophile

image.altText: Bob Hawke and Paul Keating sit next to each other at a 1983 press conference.

props.synopsis: It was a pivotal moment in the nation's history, forever changing the way we were governed and the way in which we interacted with the rest of the world.

title.children: The day the buck really did stop here

image.altText: Tall flames from a fire burn in bushland behind a road with a firefighter and police officer standing on the road.

props.synopsis: Extreme fire conditions are expected in Perth over the weekend with temperatures forecast to reach 40 degrees Celsius, as firefighters try to bring two bushfires in the city's north-east and south-east under control.

title.children: 'A challenging few days': Extreme fire danger forecast for Perth

image.altText: A man wearing a grey suit jacket and white shirt looks on with a serious expression, as he holds his chin

props.synopsis: Carl Erik Rinsch is convicted on charges that he scammed Netflix out of $US11 million for a show that never materialised, instead using the cash for purchases including luxury cars and homewares.

title.children: Hollywood director convicted of scamming $16.5m from Netflix

image.altText: A group of tech CEOs sit on a metal construction beam, a throwback to a famous photograph of workers on a skyscraper.

props.synopsis: The magazine cites the tremendous technological advances made by the artificial intelligence industry over the past year in bringing on the age of "thinking machines".

title.children: TIME magazine names 'The Architects of AI' as Person of the Year

image.altText: The exterior of an ANZ Bank branch.

props.synopsis: Former ANZ chief executive Shayne Elliott is suing the bank for stripping him of $13.5 million in bonuses. Local stocks are rallying after the Dow hit new records in a mixed session for Wall Street overnight. Follow live.

title.children: Former ANZ boss sues bank over $13.5 million in lost bonuses

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ex-ANZ boss Shayne Elliott sues banking giant after losing $13.5m in bonuses
Austal shares drop as South Korea's Hanwha gets green light to lift stake

image.altText: A composite image showing the interior of a rundown prison cell

props.synopsis: The NSW's prisons watchdog has deemed parts of Long Bay Jail "unsafe" and "dilapidated" and "incapable of providing safe and humane" conditions.

title.children: Photos from scathing report show inside 'dilapidated' Sydney jail

image.altText: unidentified teenage girl talking to a doctor

props.synopsis: Hospital managers and executives in NSW will be barred from blocking abortions because of moral and religious views, according to a document obtained by the ABC.

title.children: NSW hospital execs could be barred from blocking abortions on religious grounds

image.altText: Nemo stands on  stage after winning the trophy in 2024

props.synopsis: Swiss singer Nemo says they will return the trophy they won in 2024 over the EBU's decision to let Israel participate in 2026.

title.children: 2024 Eurovision winner returns trophy over Israel's participation

image.altText: Bridge with curved cover over road

props.synopsis: After being plagued by cost blowouts and delays, Melbourne's West Gate Tunnel will be ready to take motor vehicles from Sunday, say multiple sources.

title.children: Melbourne's West Gate Tunnel 'ready to take cars from Sunday'

image.altText: Gianni Infantino sits behind the FIFA World Cup trophy

props.synopsis: A fans organisation lashes out at "extortionate" prices for tickets at next year's FIFA World Cup despite claims from the footballing body that the tournament would be affordable.

title.children: FIFA accused of 'monumental betrayal' over new World Cup ticket prices

image.altText: Beth Mooney holding her cricket bat after a shot

props.synopsis: Sydney Sixers keeper Alyssa Healy misses a glorious chance to dismiss Beth Mooney, and the Aussie left-hander makes her pay big-time with a sparkling innings.

title.children: Mooney capitalises on Healy's blunder to send Scorchers into WBBL final

image.altText: A photo from Neighbours.

props.synopsis: Relive the highlights, such as they were, in the final episode of Neighbours, which went to air last night.

title.children: After 40 years of plot twists and drama, Neighbours wraps up for the last time — again

image.altText: Hail blankets a front yard with plants and a power pole in the background.

props.synopsis: Hailstorms have damaged homes in parts of western NSW as the cost of nearby bushfires continues to mount.

title.children: Wild hailstorms batter NSW as bushfires keep burning

image.altText: The sun sets on the horizon and against a pale blue sky you see endless rows of power lines and towers.

props.synopsis: Regional ratepayers are shouldering higher energy bills than their city counterparts, and their councils have had enough.

title.children: Electricity price blowout between city and country a 'dire situation'

image.altText: A young woman with sandy blonde hair and white skin smiles at the camera in front of green trees

props.synopsis: A Victorian Parliamentary Inquiry report finds youth career support is "severely lacking" as students fear AI is threatening white-collar industries.

title.children: Students struggle with 'workforce anxiety' trying prepare for jobs in AI future

image.altText: A house in Brisbane with rooftop solar panels

props.synopsis: The $26 million pre-election commitment from the LNP is estimated by the government to save 6,500 households around $700 on energy bills, with applications opening on Friday morning.

title.children: Landlords to be paid for installing rooftop solar on rentals in Queensland

image.altText: A woman standing in her kitchen holding two photo frames with pictures of her late husband

props.synopsis: Renee Ernst's world fell apart when her husband Troy was killed in a crash on his way home from work. She says consequences for dangerous driving need to be harsher.

title.children: Surging road toll should remind drivers ‘lives are in your hands’
